item.title: Permission Management and Custom Roles
item.description:
Permission Management Overview link

LiveAgent enables granular permission management. You can set access permissions for each user to ensure security.

Standard Roles link

Three types of standard roles are available.

Role Permission Level Main Permissions
Owner Highest Access to all settings, management, and billing information
Administrator High System settings, user management, report viewing
Agent Standard Practical operations for ticket handling and chat support

Configurable Permissions link

The following permissions can be individually configured for each role.

item.title: Contact Form Configuration
item.description:
What is a Contact Form link

A web form that can directly convert customer inquiries into tickets.

Feature Description
Automatic Ticketing Instantly register customer input as tickets
Security Accept inquiries without exposing email addresses or phone numbers
24/7 Availability Accept inquiries at any time
FAQ Integration Automatically suggest related FAQs during input

Form Types link

Type Description Use Case
Inquiry Button Display form within page on button click Site-wide inquiry acceptance
Page Form Create dedicated inquiry page When detailed information collection is needed

Form Gallery link

Start using immediately by simply selecting from pre-prepared templates.

item.title: About Multi-Language Support Feature
item.description:
Overview of Multi-Language Support Feature link

What is Multi-Language Support Feature link

Multi-language support feature is a function that allows companies expanding globally or those providing customer service in multiple languages to enable their customer support agents (staff) to use LiveAgent in their preferred language.

LiveAgent currently supports 43 languages and new translations are added regularly.

Range of Supported Languages link

Diversity of Supported Languages link

LiveAgent supports 43 languages worldwide, covering a wide range from major international languages to region-specific languages. This allows companies operating in diverse markets around the world to meet their needs.

item.title: About the Agent 'Auto Pause' Feature
item.description:
Overview link

If agents leave their workstations without logging out or pausing, they will not respond to chat or phone calls, resulting in unanswered inquiries. The “Auto Pause” feature addresses this issue.

How Auto Pause Works link

Triggering Inactive States link

When this feature is enabled, an “inactive time” timer begins the moment an agent stops being active in LiveAgent. Examples of such states include:

  • No longer typing on the keyboard within the LiveAgent interface

item.title: Adding Fields to 'Contacts' and 'Tickets'
item.description:
Overview of Custom Fields link

In LiveAgent, you can add your own customized items to customer information “Contacts” and “Tickets”. These customizations are called “adding fields” and are displayed as detailed information when agents expand tickets.

Adding Contact Fields link

Steps to Create Contact Fields link

  • From the left menu of the agent screen, select “Settings” > “System” > “Contact Fields”

  • Click the “Create” button and register the name of the new field

item.title: Agents and Teams
item.description:
Agents and Teams in LiveAgent link

Agent Overview link

Support staff who log into LiveAgent to provide customer support are called “Agents”. These agents can be grouped by job type and organized into “Teams”.

Agent Roles and Types link

Agent link

“Agents” are dedicated staff for customer service. Their primary responsibility is processing tickets, handling all customer contact channels, and answering questions and inquiries.

Administrator link

“Administrators” handle help desk management duties in addition to agent responsibilities. They manage system settings and operational reports to build better support environments.

item.title: Business Hours Settings
item.description:
Overview of Business Hours Settings link

A function to register business hours in the system and control SLA (Service Level Agreement) calculations and automatic responses based on those hours.

Benefits of Business Hours Settings link

Tickets received outside business hours are treated as next business day, preventing SLA violations. This also helps adjust customer expectations by showing “when responses will be provided,” which is useful for expectation management.

Main Features and Benefits link

Key Points:

item.title: Can activity logs be retrieved?
item.description:
About Activity Log Retrieval link

Features with Log Retrieval Capability link

SmartWeb provides detailed activity log functionality to ensure advanced security and transparency. By selecting an appropriate plan, you can track all important operations within the system and retrieve information necessary for auditing.

Main Activity Logs Recorded link

Activity logs include records of the following important activities:

  • Ticket change history (creation, updates, status changes, assignee changes, etc.)
  • Knowledge base edit history (article additions, updates, deletions)
  • Login history (users, date/time, IP addresses)
  • User permission changes
  • System configuration updates

Information Required for Auditing link

Activity logs are essential tools for corporate compliance and information security management. For example, they meet auditing needs such as:

item.title: Can I create periodic reports?
item.description:
About Periodic Report Generation link

Report Creation Availability link

Yes, by using SmartWeb’s report feature, you can automatically generate daily, weekly, and monthly reports and have them delivered via email. This feature supports efficient information management and decision-making for your business.

Report Creation Details link

Report Frequency link

You can flexibly choose the report generation frequency:

  • Daily reports: Understand detailed daily business conditions
  • Weekly reports: Check weekly progress and trends
  • Monthly reports: Utilize for long-term strategic planning

For example, customer support teams can use daily reports to analyze customer service quality, while marketing teams can use monthly reports to analyze advertising effectiveness.

item.title: Can I use Webhooks?
item.description:
Basic Webhook Features link

Webhook Support link

SmartWeb’s Webhook feature enables real-time integration between the ticket management system and external systems. When events such as ticket creation, updates, or replies occur, JSON data can be automatically POSTed to specified URLs. This allows for real-time information synchronization and significant improvement in operational efficiency.

Integration Features link

  • Real-time data transmission: Immediately notify external systems of ticket status changes
  • Flexible integration with external systems: Easy integration with CRMs, project management tools, notification systems, and more
  • JSON data format POSTing: Efficient integration of structured data
  • Customizable endpoints: Flexible configuration tailored to specific needs

Usage Examples link

Webhooks demonstrate their power in scenarios such as:

item.title: Canned Messages / Macros
item.description:
What are Canned Messages / Macros link

A feature that allows you to template frequently used responses and insert them instantly. It maintains consistency in responses and improves response speed.

For example, for common questions like “how to reset password,” you can prepare canned messages to respond within seconds. It’s also possible to execute multiple operations in bulk as macros.

Key Features link

Benefits of Templating link

  • Template frequently used responses
  • Insert responses with one click
  • Improve response consistency and speed

Feature Extensibility link

  • Automate multiple operations with macros
  • Reduce agent workload

item.title: Company Management (Companies)
item.description:
Company Management Overview link

A feature that allows you to manage customers by company. Even when multiple representatives from the same company make inquiries, you can organize information by company.

Benefits in B2B Support Environments link

In B2B support environments, it’s important to understand the overall history of customer companies. LiveAgent allows you to aggregate tickets and information by company, improving consistency in support responses.

Main Management Features link

  • Organize and manage customers by company
  • Integrate inquiries from multiple representatives
  • Information management optimized for B2B environments
  • Centralize support history by company
  • Enable more accurate and efficient responses

Benefits link

Efficient Information Management link

By aggregating information at the company level, support teams can gain a deeper understanding of relationships with customer companies, enabling faster and more accurate responses.

item.title: Contact Groups
item.description:
What are Contact Groups link

A feature that allows you to organize and manage customers by groups. By creating groups based on customer attributes and contract conditions, you can prioritize and provide special handling.

Specific Examples of Group Classification link

For example, by categorizing customers into VIP customers, corporate customers, trial users, etc., you can provide appropriate responses based on customer importance and status. This is also useful for customizing support policies.

item.title: Contact Management (Contacts)
item.description:
Contact Management (Contacts) Overview link

A feature for centrally managing customer contact information and basic details on LiveAgent. All interactions are linked to customer profiles, making it easy to review past support history.

This enables agents to better understand customer backgrounds and needs, allowing them to smoothly provide tailored responses. It serves as a CRM function that can be utilized by both sales and support teams.

Key Features link

Points:

item.title: Creating an Agent
item.description:
What is an Agent link

Support staff who use LiveAgent are called “agents.” If two or more people will be using the system, please add multiple agents.

Agent Permission Levels link

You can assign the following permissions to added agents:

  • General Agent: Handle tickets (role of responding to customers)

  • Administrator: In addition to agent functions, can access system settings and view reports

  • Owner: In addition to administrator functions, can change service plans and access billing information

item.title: Customer Management in LiveAgent: 'Contacts' and 'Companies'
item.description:
LiveAgent Customer Management: Basics of Contacts and Companies link

LiveAgent ticketizes “inquiries” from each communication channel while simultaneously acquiring and managing “customer information” associated with tickets.

Contacts: Basic Unit of Customer Information link

Automatic Contact Creation and Display link

This “customer information” is displayed as “requester” in the upper right of the screen when expanding a ticket in the agent interface. LiveAgent calls this a “contact”. Contacts are automatically created by reading only the information obtained from inquiry channels (email addresses, phone numbers, etc.). They can also be manually registered from within LiveAgent.

item.title: Department Management
item.description:
Department Management Overview link

Department management is a feature that allows you to organize and manage agents and tickets by department. It enables efficient response by dividing support tasks and leveraging specialized expertise.

Purpose of Department Management link

For example, by setting up technical support departments, billing departments, sales departments, etc., you can assign customer inquiries to the appropriate team. This increases resolution speed and improves customer satisfaction.

Key Features link

Ticket Assignment link

  • Ability to assign tickets by department

Improved Support Efficiency link

  • Efficient support leveraging specialized expertise
  • Proper routing of customer inquiries

Team Performance link

  • Clear accountability
  • Improved overall team performance

item.title: Edit Agent
item.description:
Agent Editing Overview link

You can individually configure detailed settings for newly created “Agents”.

Agent Detailed Settings link

Personal Information Details link

You can edit the information registered in “Create Agent”. The editable information is as follows:

  • Agent avatar (icon) image
  • Agent name
  • Person in charge’s email address
  • Role (agent permissions)
  • Login password
  • Gender

Email Notifications link

Edit the content to be notified to the email address registered in “Personal Information Details”. This notification can be configured simply by clicking checkboxes. The notifiable content is as follows:

item.title: Email notifications
item.description:
Email Notifications Overview link

The email notification feature is a system that informs agents of new tickets and updates in real-time.

Main Features link

A feature that sends email notifications for new tickets and updates. Agents can stay constantly informed of the latest status and won’t miss important cases.

Customizable Notification Settings link

Notification content can be customized, and settings can be configured to receive only necessary information. This prevents information overload while enabling efficient response handling.

item.title: Email Templates
item.description:
What are Email Templates link

A feature that allows you to create templates for the design and content of emails sent to customers and agents. Unifies brand image and enables efficient operation.

Benefits of Email Templates link

For example, by creating templates for frequently sent emails such as inquiry confirmation emails or resolution notifications, you can provide prompt and consistent customer support.

Main Benefits link

Key Points:

  • Unify email content and design
  • Template frequently sent emails
  • Maintain brand image
  • Improve work efficiency
  • Provide consistent support that gives customers peace of mind

Importance of Email Templates link

Unified Brand Communication link

Improved Operational Efficiency link

Enhanced Customer Satisfaction link

item.title: External Service Integration
item.description:
External Service Integration Overview link

Number of Supported Services link

SmartWeb enables integration with over 200 external services. It features high scalability that can flexibly accommodate diverse corporate workflows and business needs.

Examples of Major Supported Services link

We support major services frequently used in business such as Salesforce, Slack, Google Analytics, Shopify, and WordPress. We cover a wide range of business domains including CRM, communication, analytics, e-commerce, and content management.

item.title: How Many Staff Members Are Required for Operation?
item.description:
Approach to Required Staff for Operation link

Factors Affecting Staffing Scale link

The number of staff required for chatbot and live chat operations varies significantly depending on the following factors:

  • Number of brands, products, and services handled
  • Customer support channels (live chat, phone, email, etc.)
  • Expected volume and complexity of inquiries
  • Business hours and supported languages

For example, companies with multiple brands need support staff with specialized knowledge for each brand. On the other hand, utilizing AI chatbots can reduce the personnel needed for initial response.

item.title: How to Handle Troubleshooting?
item.description:
Support System for Troubleshooting link

Support Response Features link

SmartWeb has established a dual support system with both the developer and our company. This support approach enables swift and accurate response to customer issues. The main features include:

  • 24-hour support by specialized teams
  • Immediate analysis of technical issues
  • Multi-language support desk

Real-time Operational Status Monitoring link

We provide a status page that allows you to monitor the current state of the system in real-time. On this page, you can check the following information:

Create “Teams” to organize agents in charge of specific products, services, or departments. Dedicated agents belonging to each team can efficiently process tickets. This section introduces “Team Creation”, “Agent Registration”, and “Creating Email Templates by Team”.

Team Setup link

item.title: How to Update the Knowledge Base?
item.description:
How to Update the Knowledge Base link

Easy Article Management with WYSIWYG Editor link

You can easily add and edit articles directly from your web browser. The WYSIWYG editor allows for intuitive operation similar to Microsoft Word, with no HTML knowledge required.

Specifically, the following operations are possible:

  • Text input and formatting
  • Inserting images and videos
  • Adding links
  • Creating tables and bullet lists

Advanced Operational Features link

Category creation, display order, and access restrictions for internal-only knowledge can all be managed with just one click.

item.title: Integration Feature
item.description:
Overview of Integration Feature link

Definition of Integration Feature link

LiveAgent’s integration feature is a system that connects customer service software with other business tools and applications, allowing users to access all necessary functions from a single interface.

Benefits of Integration link

Business Efficiency Improvement link

  • Resource reduction (no additional staff needed)
  • Workflow automation
  • Reduced interface switching time

Enhanced Customer Experience link

  • Fast and consistent service delivery
  • Personalized support through data sharing
  • Improved customer satisfaction and loyalty

Key Integration Categories link

Communication Integration link

  • Slack notifications: Receive ticket notifications via Slack, respond even from smartphones
  • API integration: Enable data communication between different applications

Automation Tools link

  • Zapier: Online automation tool to streamline data movement between apps
  • Workflow automation: Automatic execution of repetitive tasks

Marketing & Sales Integration link

  • Email marketing: Maintain ongoing customer communication
  • E-commerce: Integration with online shops to support sales growth
  • CRM: Strengthen customer relationship management

Business Management Integration link

  • Billing management: Refund processing, new billing, payment history confirmation
  • Project management: Structured workflows for goal achievement
  • CMS: Easy content creation with WYSIWYG editor

Migration & Collaboration link

  • Data migration: Data transfer from other help desk software
  • Collaboration tools: Effective communication between teams

Integration Feature Details link

Slack Notifications link

Slack is a platform widely used for internal corporate communication. By integrating LiveAgent with Slack, agents can stay informed about customer inquiries at all times. Even during multitasking, tickets won’t be missed, and responses can be provided directly from Slack. Support operations can continue anywhere using the Slack app on smartphones, allowing agents to respond to LiveAgent customer inquiries regardless of location.

item.title: Internal Data Search
item.description:
Overview link

Search items viewable from the LiveAgent agent interface. If you click the “Search” button without specifying search conditions, all data will be displayed as search results.

Search Target Details link

Ticket Search link

Full search of tickets stored in the system is possible. From the agent interface left menu, display “Search” > “Tickets” and search using “Keywords” and “Custom Search Conditions” (ticket status, source, tags, etc.).

Contact Search link

Full search of “Contacts” (customer information) stored in the system is possible. From the agent interface left menu, display “Search” > “Contacts” and search using “Keywords”.

item.title: Is an API provided?
item.description:
API Availability link

API Overview link

SmartWeb provides a comprehensive RESTful API for customer support operations. This API enables integration with external systems and automation, leading to significant improvements in operational efficiency. You can programmatically control a wide range of functions including ticket management, user management, and knowledge base operations.

Available API Features link

The API covers the following major functional areas:

  • Ticket Operations

    • Creating, updating, and searching tickets
    • Changing ticket status
    • Assigning agents

  • User Management

item.title: Notification Sound Settings (Sounds)
item.description:
Notification Sound Settings Overview link

A feature that allows you to customize notification sounds played within LiveAgent. Audio alerts for new tickets and updates help prevent missed responses.

You can also disable notification sounds or set custom sounds, allowing flexible adjustment to match your work environment and personal preferences.

Key Features of Notification Sound Settings link

Real-time Notifications link

  • Instantly recognize new tickets and updates through audio alerts

Customization link

  • Customizable sound types
  • Can be disabled for quiet work environments

Business Efficiency link

  • Support for preventing missed responses
  • Adaptable to agent work styles

item.title: Region and Language Settings
item.description:
Region and Language Settings link

Regional Settings Overview link

For all languages, appropriate date and time formats for each language are defined in the system. To change the date and time format, select “Use custom date, time, and number formats” to configure.

How to Customize Date and Time Display link

  • Select “Settings” > “System” > “Language” from the left menu of the agent screen

  • Turn on the radio button for “Use custom date, time, and number formats” in “Regional Settings” to display the configuration options

item.title: Resolve Button (To Solve Button)
item.description:
Overview of the “Resolve Button” Feature link

Purpose of the Feature link

A feature that highlights tickets approaching SLA violations and encourages prompt response. Agents can quickly identify priority cases at a glance.

How to Use link

For example, clicking the “Resolve Button” allows you to view a list of tickets with approaching deadlines, enabling efficient priority handling.

Key Features link

Notification Function link

  • Notifies about tickets approaching SLA violations

Improved Work Efficiency link

  • View priority cases in a list format
  • Prevent response delays

Benefits link

  • Maintain customer satisfaction
  • Improve agent work efficiency

Requirements link

  1. Divide article content into logical sections
  2. Create major sections with h2 (##)
  3. Create detailed subsections with h3 (###)
  4. Improve existing headings if present
  5. Keep headings concise and clear
  6. Structure to function as Table of Contents

item.title: Restricting Agent Usage Environment by IP Address
item.description:
IP Address Restriction Overview link

LiveAgent allows you to restrict the usage environment when support agents log into the agent panel by IP address. You can also specify using wildcards, address ranges, and subnet masks.

How to Configure IP Address Restrictions link

Login Restriction Setup Procedure link

From the left menu of the agent panel, open “Settings” > “System” > “General” and scroll to the bottom of the page where you’ll find the “Agent panel access” section. Enter the IP addresses from which agent login should be allowed. This functions as a whitelist for login restrictions. Click “Save” to complete the configuration.

item.title: Rich Text Editor (WYSIWYG editor)
item.description:
Rich Text Editor Overview link

An intuitive rich text editor feature that works like Microsoft Word. Agents can add formatting to text and insert images and links.

By providing customers with readable and well-formatted messages, understanding becomes smoother and support quality improves.

Key Features link

Text Editing Functions link

  • Rich editing capabilities including bold text, links, images, and more
  • Intuitive operation with user experience similar to Microsoft Word

Benefits link

Improved Communication Quality link

  • Provide customers with easy-to-understand messages
  • Enhance support quality
  • Contribute to unified brand image

item.title: Share Information with Customers on the 'My Tickets' Page
item.description:
LiveAgent’s My Tickets Feature link

Overview of My Tickets link

In LiveAgent, not only agents but also customers can utilize tickets.

My Tickets Details link

My Tickets Page Functionality link

My Tickets is a web page where customers can view logs of tickets they have inquired about. When email inquiries are made or chat history is sent upon chat completion, a URL link to “My Tickets” is included in the signature section of emails sent from LiveAgent to customers.

item.title: Slack Integration
item.description:
Slack Integration link

Overview link

Slack is a popular team communication tool.

The integration plugin provides the option to automatically receive notifications in selected Slack channels for the following purposes:

New tickets Open tickets (replies from customers) Resolved tickets

Setup Instructions link

Plugin Activation link

The first step is to enable the “Slack Integration” plugin in the list under “Settings” > “System” > “Plugins”. When you enable the plugin, you will be prompted to restart the agent panel.

item.title: System Requirements (End User)
item.description:
System Requirements (End User) link

The following environments are supported for browsing web pages that incorporate LiveAgent functionality. Please check the recommended environments to use the latest communication features safely and smoothly.

PC Environment link

Supported OS link

  • Windows: Windows 10 or later (latest version recommended)
  • Mac OS: Latest macOS
  • Linux: Major distributions such as Ubuntu, Fedora

Supported Browsers link

  • Edge: Latest version recommended
  • Chrome: Latest version
  • Safari: Latest version
  • Firefox: Latest version

Since LiveAgent utilizes the latest web technologies, we recommend using the latest browsers at all times. Older browsers may not properly support advanced features such as chat functionality and screen sharing.

item.title: Tag Management
item.description:
Overview of Tag Management link

A feature that allows you to assign tags to tickets for classification and organization. Using tags makes searching and filtering easier, helping with information organization.

Specific Examples of Tag Usage link

For example, by assigning tags such as “VIP Customer,” “Refund Request,” and “Technical Support,” agents can quickly find the cases they need.

Key Benefits of Tag Management link

Flexibility link

  • Free tagging of tickets is possible

Business Efficiency link

  • Can be utilized for searching, classification, and organization
  • Easy management by priority or category
  • Supports faster customer response
  • Streamlines information sharing within teams
